perturbation.original_text: Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement; provided, however, that no policyholder of the Company may take any action authorized under this paragraph 8 unless and until (a) such policyholder has given AIG written notice of its intent to enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 8, which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with this Agreement within sixty (60) days after such notice is given; and, provided, further, that upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with paragraph 7 hereof, the rights of any policyholder as provided for under this paragraph 8 shall terminate effective as of the Termination Date, except with respect to the obligation of AIG (if any) to make capital contributions to the Company pursuant to paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement solely to the extent such obligation arose prior to, and remained unsatisfied as of, the Termination Date (it being understood that upon AIG's satisfaction of all such obligations after the Termination Date, no such policyholder shall have any rights against the Company or AIG, as the case may be, under this paragraph 8).
perturbation.changed_text: Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement; provided, however, that no policyholder of the Company may take any action authorized under this paragraph 8 unless and until (a) such policyholder has given AIG written notice of its intent to enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 8, which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with this Agreement within one hundred and eighty (180) days after such notice is given; and, provided, further, that upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with paragraph 7 hereof, the rights of any policyholder as provided for under this paragraph 8 shall terminate effective as of the Termination Date, except with respect to the obligation of AIG (if any) to make capital contributions to the Company pursuant to paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement solely to the extent such obligation arose prior to, and remained unsatisfied as of, the Termination Date (it being understood that upon AIG's satisfaction of all such obligations after the Termination Date, no such policyholder shall have any rights against the Company or AIG, as the case may be, under this paragraph 8).
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'sixty (60) days' to 'one hundred and eighty (180) days' weakens the policyholder's ability to quickly enforce their rights against AIG. Many states have prompt payment laws for insurance claims, requiring insurers to act within a reasonable timeframe. Delaying the period before a policyholder can take action could be construed as a violation of these laws, especially if the delay prejudices the policyholder's ability to recover funds in a timely manner. Texas insurance regulations, for example, may have specific timeframes that this change contradicts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Regulations concerning prompt payment of claims.

perturbation.original_text: All contributions contemplated under this Agreement shall be approved and made in compliance with applicable law, including, without limitation, approval by the board of directors of each applicable entity and any prior notice or approval requirements specified under applicable rules and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: All contributions contemplated under this Agreement shall be subject to the approval by the board of directors of each applicable entity.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'in compliance with applicable law, including, without limitation, ... and any prior notice or approval requirements specified under applicable rules and regulations' eliminates the explicit requirement for compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, including those requiring regulatory approval and notification. This omission could create a legal contradiction as insurance companies are heavily regulated and require specific regulatory approvals for capital contributions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code requiring regulatory approval for certain capital contributions.

perturbation.original_text: AIG shall have the absolute right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination (the "Termination Date"); provided, however, that AIG agrees not to terminate this Agreement unless (a) AIG significantly modifies the corporate structure or ownership of the Company, or (b) AIG sells the Company to an acquirer, in each case, (i) having a rating from at least one of S&P, Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally recognized statistical rating organization, that is at least equal to the lower of (x) AIG's then-current rating from such agency or (y) the Company's then-current rating as supported by this Agreement from such agency; or (ii) such that, immediately on the effective date of the modification of corporate structure or sale by AIG of the Company, the Company's capitalization is consistent with the minimum capital adequacy standards and criteria of at least one of S&P, Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally recognized statistical rating organization, for a rating that is equal to or better than the Company's then-current rating on the date immediately preceding such modification of corporate structure or sale.
perturbation.changed_text: AIG shall have the absolute right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination (the "Termination Date");
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause that restricts AIG from terminating the agreement unless certain conditions regarding ratings or capital adequacy are met grants AIG an unrestricted right to terminate. Insurance regulations often require that any such agreements ensuring capital adequacy can only be terminated if the insurance company's financial stability is assured even after termination. By omitting these conditions, the agreement becomes potentially non-compliant with requirements aimed at protecting policyholders by ensuring ongoing capital support.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code regulations concerning capital maintenance agreements and policyholder protection.
